result.execSummary:
The defendant Heidi L Dresser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants huber and good time.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on Friday, July 18, 2014.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no abusive contact with the children in the household.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heidi L Dresser

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Heidi L Dresser in court with attorney Kate Murtaugh.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court questions defendant.
Victim Impact statement presented. Victim's rights have been complied with.
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 3.  Court accepts and finds Guilty.
Court orders Counts 1 and 2 DRI.

Recommendation by State.
Recommendation by Attorney Murtaugh.
Court questions defendant.

Court relates and orders:
Jail - 90 days with huber and good time - Imposed & Stayed.
Probation - 1 year.
Must have no abusive contact with children in household.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  
Court Costs.
Must report to probation by 3:00 p.m. Friday.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not have any abusive contact with any of her children or Mark D.

6/10/14 MODIFIED:  MAY NOT GO ONTO ANY PREMISES WHERE ALCOHOL IS SOLD EXCEPT FOR EMPLOYMENT PURPOSES.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Heidi L Dresser in court with attorney Kate Murtaugh.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend Counts 1 and 2 to straight disorderly conduct 947.01 - Court grants amendment - Not guilty plea entered to all 3 counts - Attorney Murtaugh requests bond modification - Court orders bond modified to may not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold except for employment purposes.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
6/5/14 Letter to Judge Babler from ADA Schieffer requesting a reset of the preliminary examination.
6/6/14 Letter to ADA Schieffer from Judge Babler regarding the preliminary examination.

ADDRESS INFO for Heidi L Dresser

Prior: 2760 Barron/dunn Ave, New Auburn, WI 54757

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not have any abusive contact with any of her children or Mark D.

Defendant Heidi L Dresser in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Heidi L Dresser in custody.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 10:45 am.
